Torvin Dawnstrider wasn't born to the gleaming spires of Irda or the scholarly halls of Orba, but to the dust-choked frontier town of Stonehaven, nestled precariously near the contested borders of the Demon Lord’s ancient domains. As a youth, he witnessed the fragile peace maintained by the Knights of Falma, their silver armor gleaming under the twin suns, and knew his path lay with the sword and the sacred oath. He trained rigorously at the local chapterhouse of the Church of Falma, mastering the divine arts that flowed through his unwavering faith, yet his spirit chafed against the rigid dogma. Sent as a young Initiate-Paladin to escort merchant caravans along the perilous Orba Road, Torvin’s true education began. He didn’t just guard the wagons; he *listened* – to the desert traders of the Jirn Steppes whispering of buried Sky-Cities, the forest-dwelling Elves of the Forest of Illusions sharing fragmented songs of the World Tree’s roots, and the grim tales of dwarven stonemasons who’d glimpsed cyclopean ruins predating the Demon Lord’s rise.
